intro: Serjania dumicola, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Serjania dumicola is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
